text:
Amazing technical support. BEYOND terrible billing/customer service support. There is a complete lack of communication between these departments.
I have never in my life experienced such bad customer service. EVER. They made a mistake and forgot to backup my site due to a miscommunication between billing and technical support. I lost data ( no fault of theirs) and now have to pay a programmer to retrieve what he can from his old backup because of their error in not backing up the site- which i had paid for them to do. They refuse to talk over the phone to resolve the issue with us. And offered only to refund the amount we already paid in backup fees (which is a moot point since there is was no backup made)- Rather than offering a more reasonable solution. Its a fight over $55. Which clearly is worth more to them then a customer that pays $195 a month in hosting fees to them.
Really shocked. And so disappointed.
Be weary...

name: NevSkins Australia
text:
When will Simple Helix fix their automatic subscription issues???  Despite having an automatic subscription in place through Paypal since April, Simple Helix systems glitched and suspended my business website for late payment.   Incredibly lucky that one of our team was working in the back end of the site tonight and noticed the website was down with a big ACCOUNT SUSPENDED sign -- so we were able to fix it quickly with a manual payment.

When a business sets an account to automatic payment it is so that they don't have to keep checking payments have been taken out successfully each month -- why is this so difficult with Simple Helix ?

What is incredibly worrying, for my business, is just how many customers viewed the landing page with its single ACCOUNT SUSPENDED sign on it during the 1-2 hour window before we caught the issue and how many of those customers assumed we were out of business / or lost faith in our business ?     All because a Simple Helix system did not work as it should ?

Customer support were unhelpful and unapologetic.

name: Jared Melkun
text:
I've been using Simplehelix for a couple of years over several sites. My most recent site, on a shared hosting plan, regularly goes down due to PHP scripts run by other users on the server. This has happened three times that I know of (Simplehelix does not inform you of any outages) and each time the response has been that they are going to look into the issues. Today was the last straw -- I'm pulling all of my hosting from the company. I spend heavily on Google's AdWords to drive users to my sites; I lose money every time the site goes down. Further, Simplehelix does not consider time in which the server is not responding as downtime -- rather the server being actively connected to the internet seems to mean its up. As a result, Simplehelix claims their 99.9% reliability is met; it isn't - I was down for 35 minutes today alone.

I'm willing to overlook occasional issues, but the quality of service that I receive from this hosting company  has fallen off a cliff over the past calendar year. I'll never be back - don't make the same mistake I did.

i think they totally went off the charts with how bad support can get! words like terrible and horrible would be an understatement.. let me take you through my experience. they charge you an interest when your paypal subscription fails to deduct (note: i have a fully functioning paypal balance + credit card to back it up). no one likes to be charged interest when you're such a loyal customer who pays on time right? i pre-paid to avoid the interest because you know, they're so lenient and reasonable they would charge you interest ON TIME. oh.. wait, if this happens to you... they don't refund for pre-paid amounts. i should have expected it right? if you're thinking of hosting here... my advice is NO.. get something like shopify if you're going to start your business. uptime is great there too and u dont have to maintain your annoying monthly upgrades and people there are so nice!

Well, the person who handles billing is out on vacation and I can't login to the payment area to pay the invoice. Well, they won't restore the backup to fix our broken site that now doesn't work until we pay this $25 invoice. Crazy. You mean a $25 invoice that will get paid the next day is going to keep you from fixing my broken site today? I felt abandoned and helpless. Not a feeling you want when you need support. name: Matthew Perosi
text:
I have to detail a security breach situation caused by Simple Helix tech support.
My name and email was supposed to be removed from a client account on October 31, 2014.  Today is June 16, 2015 and my email address was CC'd in an unexpected trouble ticket thread initiated by my former client who could not log into their account.
Realizing this was not something I should be privy to I immediately replied to the thread and requested my email be removed from it.
I received an email acknowledgement within 14 minutes saying "Per Matt Perosi's request, we have removed him from the account." Yet, 8 hours later my email address is sill involved with this trouble ticket thread and their support person just sent me the complete login credentials.
I realize this is a very unusual situation, but there are many website consultants that work temporarily for different companies all the time.  Shouldn't Simple Helix have a perfected system to remove us consultants from customer accounts once our contracts expire?
They've just handed me the keys to an account I should not have access to and created a situation whereby I could be accused of harming a website I am no longer affiliated with.
Simple Helix is a good company, but I'm giving them 1 star here to call a lot of attention to this situation and to alert their customers to make sure you properly have SEO consultants removed from your accounts once consulting contract have expired.

I asked why PUT requests were being blocked by SimpleHelix and was told "we block them for security purposes" but they work perfectly on my other SimpleHelix account?

Once again, even after proving PUT requests are working on the other account, I get the same response - We block them for security purposes..

I will be moving away from SimpleHelix as soon as I find a more suitable host!

text: Had the internet for 4 years.  First 2 years I told everyone about how great their customer service and internet was.  The last 2 years it has been down more than it works.   Techs come out and their solution is always you need to pay us more and it will work.   I did do the upgrade and nothing changed.  So frustrating.

name: Jamie Leblanc
text:
I have to say the only good thing that comes from this provider are the 2 technicians I have had over the last four years and 2 customer support employees. We pay for 4mbps and for download we get 2 if that and upload is always less then 1mbps.  .7 mbps upload is as high as we normally get most of the time it's far less. Even after complaining multiple times, we where finally told the hardware for our area is to old to give us anymore then what we are getting. The employee who told us this also said the company was supposed to upgrade the equipment over 3 years back but never did. After learning this I thought about how much they have charged me over the years and never actually provided me with what they said.
I would not recommend using this provider if you can afford not to.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, we are very sorry for the trouble you've experienced. We'd like to look into this further and help. Please email us at social@consolidated.com. Thank you!

name: Shaleen Murray
text: If I could leave less than one star, this place wouldn’t get a star at all! This is the worst internet provider that has ever existed! I had better speed and reliability with dial up internet! I can’t even type a paper on google documents without it freezing and having to “reload” for the next 20 mins! I was told that it would be “so much better” once the new fiber optic stuff was hooked up! It has only gotten worse! I really didn’t think that was possible! The problem is, Consolidated has a monopoly in this area! There is no one else!

resp.text: Hi Shaleen - we are very sorry for the trouble you've continued to experience. We'd like to look into this and reach out to help. Please email us at social@consolidated.com. Thank you!

resp.text: Hi Darin, we apologize for the inconvenience you've experienced. Please email us at social@consolidated.com so we can reach out to you. Thanks!

name: Maria McBryde
text: Horrible customer service. They said they ordered a screen to repair my broken one, but on the day the screen was to arrive, they had absolutely no record of the location of the screen or even if it had been ordered. They then said it would take one more day, and when I asked the next day, they said three more days. It's been a week of "just a few more days" and still no screen. Steven M, their technician, cannot tell the location of the screen, or even if it has been ordered (even though he supposedly placed the order). Steven doesn't seem terribly concerned about checking the status until I show up in front of him. There is no response to my texts and certainly no pro-active checking on his part. Today I decided that if they cannot even tell whether a part has been ordered or where it is, then they certainly cannot be trusted to actually perform a repair. On top of that, I just realized looking at the receipt that they have listed the wrong model for my phone! I would not recommend this company at all.

resp.text:
Hello Maria,

Please allow me to apologize for the negative experiences you have encountered with our Harbert location. It is never our intention to misquote a repair time, and I am very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations. If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us, our Customer Support team would love to know! At your earliest convenience, please reach out to them at (877)320-2237 Monday through Saturday 10AM to 10PM and Sunday 12PM to 8PM EST. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: David Santos
text:
What can I say, well to start with, I was not ready for the change to a New Company because I have been with Xerox for over 25 + Years. I have always been treated very well from them so, NO I did not want to change. After a while of thinking about it SEVERAL MONTHS and my Son hammering me with the RJ YOUNG name, I did it. I purchased a machine from RJ YOUNG.
At first I was skeptical and to be honest I really didn't want to give it a chance (The Machine), but I did and after several months and barely using the machine I starting coming more around it and using it a little more & more. Then I began to really like it because it really printed so nice and pretty fast. It only took me  8 to 10 months to like it but you have to understand I WAS A XEROX Man and I thought there was NOTHING out there but Xerox. The Xerox machine has ALWAYS  performed outstanding and the SERVICE was the best, I was spoiled from that. However, I found out that there was more out there than XEROX! I found out that RJ YOUNG was REAL and believe me they have made a believer out of me. The Service that I thought would not compare to XEROX, has showed me they are just as good and if not BETTER. I never thought I would say that but it is so true. I can not believe how fast the Service Technicians reply to the service calls. They are always polite, and get me back up and running in a very quickly manner. They have such good personalities and a smile! As for the Ladies at the Home Office, Oh My How can you NOT like them. They are AMAZING. They always tell me they will have my supplies on the way or a Technician asap. IT IS JUST SO HARD TO PUT IN WORDS what RJ Young has done for my business. This is a very caring company and to be honest I am so glad that I have some of their product and that I was introduced to the World outside of XEROX. RICO machines have made my life SO MUCH Better and I am so happy that I have changed. If you are not a part of RJ YOUNG, you are probably missing out on good PEOPLE and Great Machines.
David Santos,
Santos Printing Co.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback, David! We truly appreciate it.

text: I have an older iPhone that that was locked in recovery mode.I took it to the geeks at Best Buy .I was ignored for awhile then one of their so called Geeks ask me if he could help. There is no way to recover the data and he could not even restore back to factory settings so maybe I could recover some data from I cloud.I was devastated to say the least.I do not own a computer but I do have an iPad ( old too ) .I found this place and Austin was very helpful, friendly, professional and seemed to really want to help me.He tried about 4 or more times to restore my phone so I could recover my precious data. He was not giving up, he had the knowledge to see the phone had potential to restore from the computer by the way it was trying to reconnect . I recommend everyone if anyone can fix your phone this guy Austin will if possible. He was so nice and really determined to help me.The price was very reasonable and the customer service was outstanding. I will tell everyone about this place, and the geek squad is a joke.They are a bunch of young kids who are just running around with their nose up in the air like they know it all.They definetly do not know much about Apple Products and how the I cloud stores you info. You just have to know how to get it and Austin did. Thank you again Austin, you saved me.

name: Jonny Gaston - Evangelist
text:
I really was hopeful that this business would be a overall pleasant experience. Got my 2017 IPad fixed there. Customer service was great in the beginning. But then it took extra long for them to repair my iPad. Cosmo said 5 days. I still had no iPad for 12-14 days. Every time I called they gave me the “run-around”
They left some messages and they also was waiting on me to give the ok to wipe my iPad since it was disabled. However when I called because I still had no idea when I would get it back, all I got was excuses why it was my fault it had not been repaired yet.

I finally got it back when I pressed them to make it happen. And they did a good job at the repair. I might even give them another shot and change my review, but for now my experience was frustrating. All I needed them to say was “Hey , sorry that’s our fault for giving you an unrealistic timeframe for the repair, we are going to make this right!”

But all I got from them was a bit of an attitude and excuses.

I need my Mac book fixed as well. I might go else where. But I am not closed to giving them another chance. Maybe they were just having a bad day. I’m not sure. I wish my experience was better.

resp.text: I’m sorry that your experience was less than ideal and we will try to set better time expectations for you in the future.   Since the device was disabled we didn’t want to reset the device to factory without your permission since doing so deletes all the data on the device.  In hindsight, we should of gotten your permission to reset the device when you dropped it off with us.  Had we done so, the repair would of been completed much more quickly.   I hope that you do give us another chance to serve you, and I promise we will get your MacBook fixed in a timely manner.

name: John Bobbitt
text:
Called them regarding some new, and some used parts id like to sell from an aborted build, plus others besides. Told them exactly what (SPSPECIFICALLY AN INTEL PROCESSOR, expandable RAM, motherboards, lcd screen,) I had and they told me to come on. I went to probably irritating lengths to confirm that they bought these highly specific parts. In retrospect, I thought the name,odd, but after a long day didnt put the "mac" portion together....or I'd have asked SPECIFICALLY if they bought non-mac items. So,  I drove out from Theodore during rush hour....and they declined everything because it wasnt MAC (wed discussed what I had, mind you) and because they couldn't test board soldered parts.... He said that in refereme to RAM memory chips, a desktop cpu, and my 500gb hard drives...they only take solid state now, he said. And so on, and so on...

I dunno what the game they were playing was, but I think experimac owes me a half tank of gas and an appology. Take the gas from the guy's paycheck (if you're paying guys who think UPGRADABLE RAM is soldered to the board, anyway. And processors and graphics cards for that matter) for so politely convincing me to bring it all out there after being given models and brands.  Everything I could do to maintain some class before I left. Nothing worse than going out of your way to ensure its not a fruitless trip, only to get there and find some genius has given you bad info...and then instead of owning it....lying through his teeth ever so easily with a smile on his face. Aparently my cloths from a day under my cars hood, disguised my occupation as an aerospace engineer.... and I looked like someone who believed hard drives require soldering. In the parking lot now trying to figure gasoline vs. Dive distance.

RESPONSE TO BUSINESS: No, I'm passing. At this point, I believe ive done what's necessary to prevent this happening to someone else. I've made them aware. You know who screwed the pooch, you know what they did...and for that matter, the african American young man who provides the quotes (according to the Liar) knew, and yet hid in the back and let the guy I dealt with do his thing. I'm wondering if THAT is in the fact Cosmo you speak of. In which case, he didnt do anything then, so I dont believe hed do anything NOW. I dont believe your store would have poated a response at all, if not for the star by my name.

You intentionally ignored my suggestion of gas compensation, and while your words are very well put together to give the impression of being amicable....the previous young mans words were pretty enough to get me out there. Fool me once, sir....yet not twice.

A whole paragraph you've written in response that says essentially... Nothing.

2 weeks Later: See folks? Still no response... Just ran and hid. Guilty.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not make it clear over the phone that we only buy Apple products.  You should of been told this over the phone.  We want to talk with you about the experience so that we can avoid something like this happening to anyone else.  Please call us at the store 251-308-8276 and ask for Cosmo.

The man that helped me was wonderful, stayed a little late on a Friday for me, and 100% saved my day and weekend. Go there to get your stuff fixed!!

Had another issue a couple years later and Richard was able to fix it with no problem!

He is a definitely the guy to see!!
Great prices & great service.

text: To say I'm pleased is a huge understatement. My laptop needed a new battery and a fan, a problem I thought would take days to solve. text: Richard is an absolute professional.  Incredibly nice guy and gets the job done.  I highly recommend "The Computer Store."

name: Steve Horlebein
text:
Did a great job at replacing my MacBook screen, upgrading my hard drive, recovering my data and prior customization, and updating the memory chips.  All in one day!  Very impressive and professional.  Oh, did I mention they turned it around in less than 6 hours after they confirmed the special order parts had arrived?  Plus their shop dog is very sweet and gentle.  The upgrades were expensive due to the hardware costs, not their labor charges.
I have over 30 years of professional I/T experience but am now happily retired and no longer have access to a lab with proper tools and other equipment to make the repairs/upgrades/restores myself.  Without hesitation I will return—they are now my default place to go for computer repairs.  I would recommend them to everyone I meet who might need such maintenance or repairs.  Even my favorite relatives!  Thanks!

I clearly was in front of the employer who cut it off for me , and I saw her do it myself. So when the technician guy said other wise, I knew he was lying. name: Jazlyn Terry
text:
Name should be: ubreakibreakmore

Brought my Google Pixel 4XL in to have a screen replacement through Verizon insurance. I dropped off the phone at 10am and agreed to a 4-6 hour wait time. Everything worked on the phone when it was dropped off, damage was strictly cosmetic (I have a receipt with a checklist and phone history to prove this). Gave another phone number for shop to call when finished. I return at 6:30pm (because shop closes at 7) to see what is going on with my phone and they bring it out with a still broken screen. They could not fix the screen, but apparently messed up more in the process. The phone will now not function AT ALL. It will not even turn off. I was not given any resolution other than call Verizon and file a claim, which is the exact reason I was here to start with.

STAY AWAY!!!!

name: Nelson Bond
text: Fast scheduling, part was in inventory when I called (Pixel 3a screen). As a Google authorized service provider, I had confidence going in, and I wasn't disappointed. Jason did a fantastic repair, efficient, and courteous. Highly recommended! Hope I don't have to go back, but if necessary, I will!

name: Holly Green
text: Their customer service is amazing, we were in and out in no time.  Extremely friendly and fixed our problem.

name: Rickey P.
text:
Great place to get your electronics fixed. I had to get a Galaxy Note 9 screen replaced, the website gives you an exact quote of how much it will cost. It wasn't too bad, I five other repair shops both in Madison and Huntsville, they all gave me about the same price for the repair. The technician gave me an estimated wait time (an hour) and said it will be done by then. I got called within 45 minutes, and the screen was as good as new. Pretty straight forward process.

The price was decent compared to what it would cost me to buy the screen from a supplier, labor cost wasn't too bad either. They did a fine job. Thanks!

resp.text: Hello Rickey, we are glad we were able to help get your Note 9 back up and running! We always strive to provide quick and affordable repairs using only the highest quality parts, and we are happy to assist you with any future repair needs!

name: Richard Swaim
text: My iPhone had a broken screen and housing (back glass) when I brought it in for repairs.  Anthony explained the process thoroughly and provided me with a loaner phone because they didn’t have the housing in stock.  The part was overnighted to the store and repaired the next day.  Unfortunately, due to a defect in my particular phone the repair was unsuccessful and had to have some sort of wiring replaced for the home button- which needed to be done by Apple in California.  Anthony again communicated very well and advised me of every step throughout the process. He worked tirelessly and even came in on his off day to get it resolved.  My phone was replaced and is now working better than ever.  Anthony is an asset to this company.  His customer service and communication skills are fantastic and were throughout the entire process.  I will recommend these guys to all my friends and family and would not hesitate to take my devices back if any repairs are needed in the future.

text:

Edit for reply:
My wife called Tuesday 1/5/21 and told whoever answered the phone, after telling them my issue (power button on my Samsung Galaxy S10 plus fell off). She was told that it wouldn't be a problem and no appointment needed that it'd be $79.00. As I mentioned before I live 45 miles away, I had to leave work early to make sure I had ample time to get there and to get service.
Yes, you are correct,  there was not a record or service ticket made because the guy there looked at my phone said that I'd have to leave it and that the parts would be $300.00 because the board would have to be changed out that the button was all one unit. I value my time and money as much as everyone else and I left without your service. Yes, I do feel like the initial phone call was a bait and switch just to get someone in the store. You know that $19.99 oil change costs $500 because you need tires,wipers, injector cleaning and "blinker fluid". It's just strange that my wife was told one thing and I was told another. I called another shop  told them exactly what was wrong, they said same thing. No problem, no appointment needed.  Took phone, they looked at it and the fixed it for the amount quoted.
Funny thing that one shop said one thing and the other one did it.

resp.text:
Jason, I cannot find a repair ticket or record of your name, are you sure you have the right place? If so, I would like to reach out to you to find out what happened, as we do not give bogus pricing to obtain business. Mistakes do happen and if this indeed did happen, I'd love the chance to make it right!

We have a proven track record of being transparent throughout our entire repair process and we pride ourselves on having some of the best pricing in the industry. I especially appreciate this review because it gives me a chance to explain our repair process.

Before I start, i'd like to point out one thing, there is a giant discrepancy between $80.00 and $300.00. The only phone parts that cost this much are some of the Genuine Samsung Display Assemblies. If another shop was able to resolve this for $85.00, it was a small part repair, like a charging port or proxy sensor, for example. (If parts were needed.) My point is, our prices would have been comparable.

When a customer calls in to obtain a price on a particular repair we do our best to go over the details of the problem or issue they are experiencing. If we are confident we know the solution to the issue at hand, we then will give you a price or at least a ballpark figure, so they know what to expect. If we are unsure what the solution is to the issue, we will ask you to bring the device in to be diagnosed, before giving you a price on the repair.

The Process.

1. Once you come into our office, we go over the details of the issue you are experiencing with your device. We will then go over repair solutions or inform you that it will need further diagnostics to obtain the solution to the issue.

2. We then obtain all your contact information and create you a ticket. We may at this time give you a price on the repair. Below are a couple normal situations.

*Lets go over a couple examples, an iPhone 8, the screen is damaged, everything else on the device is working as intended (we verify this,) we give you a price on the display assembly replacement and an ETA for expected completion.

*Now, lets say its a Gaming Computer, it is randomly turning off or blue screening. We will not know what the issue is without diagnosing all the hardware. In this situation, we will inform you that we will need to perform additional diagnostics to know what it will take to repair this device.

3. Once we have obtained the device, we then will start the diagnostics or repair in the order that it came in. We have other repairs in front of new repairs. Your device will go into the queue and will be worked on when its ticket is next. There are two exceptions to this. Most phone screen repairs, if we have the parts on hand (which we do for all iPhones and some Samsungs,) are completed in an hour or less. (Time will vary depending on the particular repair.) The other exception is, we offer a rush service, this service is paid at the time of when you drop off the device. This is paid to have the device worked on immediately, otherwise tickets are worked on in the order they are received.

4. Once the repair or diagnosis is completed, we then will email, text, and/or call you, to go over any final or further details.

5. Pick up your device and pay for the repairs. Once a repair is completed you can come by and pick up your device at your convenience. We also offer payment options, you can pay in person with cash or card, or you can pay your invoice through our online portal.

**One quick notes, due to COVID-19, we are not allowing our customers to wait on repairs in the lobby. They must either drop them off, wait in the their car, or outside of the building.

Jason, thank you for allowing us to go over this process with you and potential customers that may be reading this. Feel free to reach out to me, Clint Silver, owner at ProTek. I would love to know what happened and would love the opportunity to make it right. Thank you and as always, thanks for choosing ProTek!

name: Courtland Byrd
text:
I want to start by saying that after comparing tech repair companies I chose ProTek because of their great reviews. I debated leaving this review because I know how harmful bad reviews can be to a small business. Unfortunately, my experience with ProTek was so disappointing I felt obligated to share.
When replacing my screen ProTek compromised the integrity of my water resistant IPhone XS causing it to be hyper sensitive to moisture. This resulted in my phone being corroded by light water exposure only 3days after the iPhone repair. ProTek then refused to refund me the 200$ for the faulty screen replacement which essentially destroyed my 1000$ phone. Let me be clear that my IPhone had been exposed to water on previous occasions to the screen replacement with no issues. ProTek even assured me that there was no water damage prior to the screen replacement. I had expected to have a better experience with ProTek because I had confidence in their customer reviews. Sadly, I have to say I was dissatisfied with their services. At the very least I hope others will take my experience with ProTek into consideration and proceed with caution in regards to ProTek’s remarkable ineptitude with apple products.

resp.text:
I am very disappointed by this review, i'll explain why. Unfortunately for phones, we are in the warmer months and people like to be on the water and when you're on the water, these type of things will happen. I want to start off by saying that we repair and/or recover data from thousands of water damage devices. When you first brought the iPhone in for a screen replacement it was because you left the iPhone in the rain and it ruined the screen. (We informed the customer that the screen was the only thing damaged by the rain.) We replaced the screen and put a new screen seal on it, (as we do with all repairs.) The phone then came back with standing water inside the device, this amount of water is concurrent with other phones we see that have been submerged into water. The customer asked for a warranty on the screen, unfortunately we cannot warranty water or physical damage. (Simply putting a new screen on this iPhone would not resolve the issue, given the current condition.) In a case like this, with standing water inside the device, we would need to let the water dry (we have tools to speed this process up.) After the water has dried, it will leave corrosion behind, which will need to be cleaned. We would then remove the logic board from the iPhone housing, clean it with our Sonic Cleaner, and then test the device for further component damage. We then would replace the components needed to repair the device. More than likely we could have saved this customers phone, had the customer let us complete the water damage assessment on this device.

Please remember that iPhone's are not water proof, they are water resistant, and each iPhone has its own water resistance rating. We have seen water damage happen in pretty much every way, from being in your pocket and sweating, to being on the bathroom counter while taking a shower, and to drops in the ocean. Each iPhone handles each exposure differently, because in each exposure, the conditions are different. If you are going to be around water, buy a water proof bag, put your phone into the bag and use it from the outside the bag, only to remove it if you need to make a phone call. This will drastically minimize the chance of water damage. I hope this reply has answered any questions as to how we handle water damaged phones here at ProTek. If you have any questions, concerns, or just want some friendly advice, feel free to contact us at your convenience!

text: Top notch company - super fast results!  My M.2 SSD work hard drive crashed, and after my own IT dep't couldn't fix it, I took it in and it was ALL recovered! They returned my call promptly, reminded me that they close at 7pm and were not trying to rush me into seeing them the next day, and offered to assess my hard drive w/out charging me.  In about 5 minutes he came back and said it was all there, and then explained the difference between the $150 cost, and the $300 cost.  basically if I wanted 40GB of files in one folder, it was $150.  if I wanted it to look like it did (folder structure) before the crash, it woudl take more time and therefore $300.  Best extra $150 I have ever spent!  They found info from several previous users, which I'm sure my IT dep't will be thrilled with, lol.  They were great to communicate with, no suprises, met all my expectations, and delivered.  I will go back to them ANY time I need something recovered (or break my phone - didn't even know they fixed phones).  Thanks ProTek!

name: Scott Dickinson
text:
Ever get that sick feeling in your stomach when you've messed something up? That was me. I had taken apart my laptop because of excessive dust on the fan and the put it back together incorrectly. Seeing an ad for a national company in Huntsville that did computer repair I took it there. 3 weeks later and I get a call that says they can't fix it locally and need to send it off, $75 please.

Discouraged, I collect my laptop and buy a new one. But then I realize I need documents that were stored locally on the old laptop. So searching the internet, I find ProTek. I call and they tell me they can recover my  data.

So I bring my old laptop and then they say, hey, can we try and fix it? Sure, I say. One week later, they've fixed my laptop, and it's up and running for less then what I paid for a new laptop!

Fantastic work! So before you take it to a national place, give the local guys at ProTek a chance to fix your laptop! You won't regret it !

resp.text: Hello Chelsea Pickett, thanks so much for the review! We always try to be upfront about estimates on repair cost and results.
